payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Key Files
The heart of this repository is the automation script `instalador.sh` located at the project root. Every contribution should start by understanding its sequential flow: environment setup, dependency installation, service configuration, and cleanup. The script streams progress and diagnostics into `scripts/chatia-install.log`; treat that log as the canonical record of any installation run. When exercising new logic, always confirm that the log captures start and end markers, command output, and error traces so operators can replay the narrative after the fact.

## Build & Validation Workflow
Before pushing changes, run `bash -n instalador.sh` to catch syntax errors and `shellcheck instalador.sh` to flag quoting, heredoc, or command-substitution issues. Execute `sudo ./instalador.sh` inside a disposable VM or container, redirecting output with `sudo ./instalador.sh | tee scripts/chatia-install.log` if you need real-time visibility. After each run, archive a copy of `scripts/chatia-install.log` alongside your test notes; this log must exist and be readable even when the script exits early.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Maintain two-space indentation inside functions and align closing braces flush left. Name functions and locals in lower_snake_case; reserved environment variables, constants, and heredoc delimiters remain UPPER_SNAKE_CASE. Prefer the shared logging helpers (`log_info`, `log_error`, etc.) so that `scripts/chatia-install.log` stays uniform. For heredocs executed through nested shells (e.g., `sudo -u deploy bash -lc`), always use the single-quoted form `<<'DELIM'` to prevent double expansion and garbled output in the log.

## Working with scripts/chatia-install.log
Never commit the log file, but do rely on it for validation. Ensure each major block in `instalador.sh` emits a clear header, success message, and error branch so troubleshooting is linear. When introducing new steps, add context-rich messages (command being run, target host, expected result) and append actionable remediation hints when failures occur. If you rotate or truncate the log in your workflow, document the convention in your PR so operators replicate it reliably.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Follow the existing history pattern of `checkpoint - <percent>` for iterative work; only use `checkpoint - 100%` when the installer and accompanying log output prove production ready. Every PR should outline what changed in `instalador.sh`, summarise validation commands, and attach or reference the relevant excerpt of `scripts/chatia-install.log` that demonstrates success and failure handling.

<user_instructions>

# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Key Files
The heart of this repository is the automation script `instalador.sh` located at the project root. Every contribution should start by understanding its sequential flow: environment setup, dependency installation, service configuration, and cleanup. The script streams progress and diagnostics into `scripts/chatia-install.log`; treat that log as the canonical record of any installation run. When exercising new logic, always confirm that the log captures start and end markers, command output, and error traces so operators can replay the narrative after the fact.

## Build & Validation Workflow
Before pushing changes, run `bash -n instalador.sh` to catch syntax errors and `shellcheck instalador.sh` to flag quoting, heredoc, or command-substitution issues. Execute `sudo ./instalador.sh` inside a disposable VM or container, redirecting output with `sudo ./instalador.sh | tee scripts/chatia-install.log` if you need real-time visibility. After each run, archive a copy of `scripts/chatia-install.log` alongside your test notes; this log must exist and be readable even when the script exits early.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
Maintain two-space indentation inside functions and align closing braces flush left. Name functions and locals in lower_snake_case; reserved environment variables, constants, and heredoc delimiters remain UPPER_SNAKE_CASE. Prefer the shared logging helpers (`log_info`, `log_error`, etc.) so that `scripts/chatia-install.log` stays uniform. For heredocs executed through nested shells (e.g., `sudo -u deploy bash -lc`), always use the single-quoted form `<<'DELIM'` to prevent double expansion and garbled output in the log.

## Working with scripts/chatia-install.log
Never commit the log file, but do rely on it for validation. Ensure each major block in `instalador.sh` emits a clear header, success message, and error branch so troubleshooting is linear. When introducing new steps, add context-rich messages (command being run, target host, expected result) and append actionable remediation hints when failures occur. If you rotate or truncate the log in your workflow, document the convention in your PR so operators replicate it reliably.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
Follow the existing history pattern of `checkpoint - <percent>` for iterative work; only use `checkpoint - 100%` when the installer and accompanying log output prove production ready. Every PR should outline what changed in `instalador.sh`, summarise validation commands, and attach or reference the relevant excerpt of `scripts/chatia-install.log` that demonstrates success and failure handling.


</user_instructions>

      UNACCENT_EXT=\$(psql -d \"${empresa}\" -Atqc \"SELECT 1 FROM pg_extension WHERE extname='unaccent'\" || true)
      if [ \"\$UNACCENT_EXT\" != \"1\" ]; then
        psql -d \"${empresa}\" -c \"CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS unaccent;\"
      fi
    '
  "
fi

#------------------- ETAPA 13: Código ------------------------------------------
SOURCE_DIR="$(pwd)/chatia"; DEST_DIR="/home/deploy/${empresa}"
run_quiet "$(t installing) ChatIA code..." "GITHUB_TOKEN='${github_token}' REPO_URL='${repo_url}' bash -lc '
  set -e
  sync_performed=false
  copy_tree() {
    local src=\"\$1\" dest=\"\$2\"
    mkdir -p \"\$dest\"
    if command -v rsync >/dev/null 2>&1; then
      rsync -a \"\$src/\" \"\$dest/\"
    else
      cp -a \"\$src/.\" \"\$dest/\"
    fi
  }
  copy_file_if_present() {
    local src=\"\$1\" dest=\"\$2\"
    if [ -f \"\$src\" ]; then
      cp -a \"\$src\" \"\$dest\"
    fi
  }
  urlenc() { local s=\"\$1\" out=\"\" i c; for ((i=0;i<\${#s};i++)); do c=\"\${s:i:1}\"; case \"\$c\" in [a-zA-Z0-9._~-]) out+=\"\$c\" ;; *) printf -v hex \"%%%02X\" \"'\''\$c\"; out+=\"\$hex\" ;; esac; done; echo \"\$out\"; }
  tmpd=\$(mktemp -d /tmp/chatia_clone_XXXXXX)
  cleanup_tmp() { [ -d \"\$tmpd\" ] && rm -rf \"\$tmpd\"; }
  trap cleanup_tmp EXIT

  mkdir -p \"$DEST_DIR\"

  if [ \"\$GITHUB_TOKEN\" != \"local_install\" ] && [ -n \"\$GITHUB_TOKEN\" ] && [ -n \"\$REPO_URL\" ]; then
    tok=\$(urlenc \"\$GITHUB_TOKEN\")
    clean=\${REPO_URL#http://}; clean=\${clean#https://}
    github_url=\"https://\$tok@\${clean}\"
    git clone --depth 1 --filter=blob:none \"\$github_url\" \"\$tmpd\"
    if [ -d \"\$tmpd/chatia\" ]; then
      copy_tree \"\$tmpd/chatia/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
      copy_tree \"\$tmpd/chatia/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
      copy_file_if_present \"\$tmpd/chatia/ecosystem.config.js\" \"$DEST_DIR/\"
    elif [ -d \"\$tmpd/backend\" ] && [ -d \"\$tmpd/frontend\" ]; then
      copy_tree \"\$tmpd/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
      copy_tree \"\$tmpd/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
      copy_file_if_present \"\$tmpd/ecosystem.config.js\" \"$DEST_DIR/\"
    else
      exit 9
    fi
    sync_performed=true
  elif [ -d \"$SOURCE_DIR\" ]; then
    copy_tree \"$SOURCE_DIR/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
    copy_tree \"$SOURCE_DIR/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
    copy_file_if_present \"$SOURCE_DIR/ecosystem.config.js\" \"$DEST_DIR/\"
    sync_performed=true
  elif [ -f \"$(pwd)/ChatIA.zip\" ]; then
    command -v unzip >/dev/null 2>&1 || apt -y -qq install unzip
    unzip -q \"$(pwd)/ChatIA.zip\" -d \"$DEST_DIR\"
    if [ -d \"$DEST_DIR/chatia\" ]; then
      copy_tree \"$DEST_DIR/chatia/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
      copy_tree \"$DEST_DIR/chatia/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
      copy_file_if_present \"$DEST_DIR/chatia/ecosystem.config.js\" \"$DEST_DIR/\"
      rm -rf \"$DEST_DIR/chatia\"
    fi
    sync_performed=true
  elif [ -d \"$(pwd)/codigo fonte/\" ]; then
    copy_tree \"$(pwd)/codigo fonte/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
    copy_tree \"$(pwd)/codigo fonte/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
    sync_performed=true
  else
    exit 10
  fi

  if [ \"\$sync_performed\" = true ]; then
    mkdir -p \"$DEST_DIR/backend/public\"
    chown -R deploy:deploy \"$DEST_DIR\"
    chmod -R 775 \"$DEST_DIR/backend/public\"
  fi
'"

#------------------- ETAPA 14: Backend .env ------------------------------------
ENV_PATH="/home/deploy/${empresa}/backend/.env"
JWT_SECRET_EXISTING=""
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_EXISTING=""
if [ -f "$ENV_PATH" ]; then
  JWT_SECRET_EXISTING="$(grep -E '^JWT_SECRET=' "$ENV_PATH" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | cut -d'=' -f2-)"
  JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_EXISTING="$(grep -E '^JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=' "$ENV_PATH" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | cut -d'=' -f2-)"
fi
JWT_SECRET_VALUE="${JWT_SECRET_EXISTING:-$jwt_secret}"
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_VALUE="${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_EXISTING:-$jwt_refresh_secret}"

ENV_TMP="$(mktemp)"
cat > "$ENV_TMP" <<ENVFILE
NODE_ENV=production
BACKEND_URL=${subdominio_backend_formatted}
FRONTEND_URL=${subdominio_frontend_formatted}
PROXY_PORT=443
PORT=${backend_port}

DB_HOST=localhost
DB_DIALECT=postgres
DB_PORT=5432
DB_USER=${empresa}
DB_PASS=${senha_deploy}
DB_NAME=${empresa}

REDIS_URI=redis://:${senha_deploy}@127.0.0.1:6379
REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_MAX=1
REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_DURATION=3000

TIMEOUT_TO_IMPORT_MESSAGE=1000

JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET_VALUE}
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_VALUE}
MASTER_KEY=${senha_master}

VERIFY_TOKEN=whaticket
FACEBOOK_APP_ID=${facebook_app_id}
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

payload.text:
**Reviewing extensive code modifications**

I’m taking a close look at a large block of changes affecting frontend and backend files, including regenerating configs, rewriting pages, and modifying dependencies. My goal is to identify which changes actually alter repo code and could be simplified by updating the repo itself rather than patching in scripts. I’m also checking for all `sed -i` operations that rewrite files to get a full picture of inline code edits.

I'm gathering precise line numbers from the large install script to map all backend and frontend file changes, focusing on the dependency steps and config rewrites. I'll use line-number tools to reference exact lines for an in-depth analysis in Portuguese, aiming to guide the user on possible repo simplifications.

payload.text:
**Outlining final response structure**

I’m organizing a detailed yet concise final message in Portuguese that summarizes key backend and frontend script changes with specific line references, grouping related modifications into 4-6 bullet points per section for clarity. I’m also planning suggestions for integrating these changes into the repo to simplify maintenance and highlighting brittle script parts worth committing directly.

payload.message:
**Visão Geral**
- O instalador baixa o código para `/home/deploy/${empresa}` e, em seguida, aplica vários patches manuais no backend e frontend; quase todos podem (e idealmente deveriam) ser incorporados diretamente ao repositório GitHub para eliminar essas reescritas na instalação.

**Backend**
- `instalador.sh:1428` sobrescreve `tsconfig.json` e injeta dependências (`puppeteer-core`, `glob`, `jimp`, `mime` etc.) via `pnpm add`; incluir esse `tsconfig` e as dependências (com respectivos locks) no repositório evitaria recriação e reinstalação forçada a cada deploy.
- `instalador.sh:1429-1430` aplica `sed` em todos os `.ts` para trocar `mime-types` por `mime` e adiciona fallback em `SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts`; esses ajustes devem viver no código-fonte para que os builds locais e CI reflitam a mesma lógica robusta.
- `instalador.sh:1432` edita `node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js` para apontar para `/usr/bin/ffmpeg` e cria manualmente `node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/package.json`; melhor expor uma variável de ambiente (`FFMPEG_PATH`) ou manter o wrapper configurado no repositório, evitando manipular `node_modules` em runtime.

**Frontend**
- `instalador.sh:1477-1492` remove locks (`node_modules`, `pnpm-lock.yaml`), adiciona dependências (axios, clsx, polyfills browserify etc.) e troca scripts do `react-scripts` para `craco`; o `package.json`/lockfile do repositório deveria já refletir essa pilha para prevenir divergências entre ambientes.
- `instalador.sh:1493-1521` gera `craco.config.js` com ajustes de webpack (fallbacks, remoção de ESLint/ModuleScope); esse arquivo deve ser versionado para manter o bundler consistente.
- `instalador.sh:1522-1537` cria `server.js` (Express + dotenv) e adiciona `express/dotenv`; incluir o servidor no repositório evita que o instalador replique código.
- `instalador.sh:1538-1593` recria `src/config/env.{js,ts}` para ler variáveis em runtime; manter esses módulos no repositório (eventualmente parametrizados) remove a necessidade de duplicação e riscos de drift.
- `instalador.sh:1595-1688` remove `react-trello` e injeta páginas placebo de Kanban/Tags; a exclusão definitiva da dependência e os componentes placeholders podem ser aplicados diretamente na base Git.
- `instalador.sh:1690-1697` força `serviceWorker.unregister()` em `src/index.(js|tsx)`; incorporar essa alteração no repositório garante comportamento uniforme em ambientes de desenvolvimento e produção.

**Sugestões**
- 1) Portar todos os patches listados para o repositório (atualizar `package.json`, `tsconfig`, componentes e utilitários) e publicar um release para que o instalador apenas sincronize/instale dependências.  
- 2) Revisar se alguma dessas customizações deve ser parametrizável; caso sim, mover a lógica para flags/envs no próprio código em vez de `sed`.  
- 3) Após aplicar as mudanças no GitHub, limpar o instalador (remover `sed`, `cat >`, `pnpm add` redundantes) e validar com `bash -n`, `shellcheck` e um deploy real usando o novo código.

      1. Portar todos os patches listados para o repositório (atualizar package.json, tsconfig, componentes e utilitários)
         e publicar um release para que o instalador apenas sincronize/instale dependências.
      2. Revisar se alguma dessas customizações deve ser parametrizável; caso sim, mover a lógica para flags/envs no
         próprio código em vez de sed.
      3. Após aplicar as mudanças no GitHub, limpar o instalador (remover sed, cat >, pnpm add redundantes) e validar com
         bash -n, shellcheck e um deploy real usando o novo código.

content.text:
Crie na raiz do projeto um arquivo .md com um plano multi task file em etapas atomicas para implementar o seguinte: • Visão Geral

  - O instalador baixa o código para /home/deploy/${empresa} e, em seguida, aplica vários patches manuais no backend e
    frontend; quase todos podem (e idealmente deveriam) ser incorporados diretamente ao repositório GitHub para eliminar
    essas reescritas na instalação.

  Backend

  - instalador.sh:1428 sobrescreve tsconfig.json e injeta dependências (puppeteer-core, glob, jimp, mime etc.) via pnpm
    add; incluir esse tsconfig e as dependências (com respectivos locks) no repositório evitaria recriação e reinstalação
    forçada a cada deploy.
  - instalador.sh:1429-1430 aplica sed em todos os .ts para trocar mime-types por mime e adiciona fallback em
    SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts; esses ajustes devem viver no código-fonte para que os builds locais e CI reflitam a mesma
    lógica robusta.
  - instalador.sh:1432 edita node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js para apontar para /usr/bin/ffmpeg e cria
    manualmente node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/package.json; melhor expor uma variável de ambiente (FFMPEG_PATH)
    ou manter o wrapper configurado no repositório, evitando manipular node_modules em runtime.

  Frontend

  - instalador.sh:1477-1492 remove locks (node_modules, pnpm-lock.yaml), adiciona dependências (axios, clsx, polyfills
    browserify etc.) e troca scripts do react-scripts para craco; o package.json/lockfile do repositório deveria já
    refletir essa pilha para prevenir divergências entre ambientes.
  - instalador.sh:1493-1521 gera craco.config.js com ajustes de webpack (fallbacks, remoção de ESLint/ModuleScope); esse
    arquivo deve ser versionado para manter o bundler consistente.
  - instalador.sh:1522-1537 cria server.js (Express + dotenv) e adiciona express/dotenv; incluir o servidor no repositório
    evita que o instalador replique código.
  - instalador.sh:1538-1593 recria src/config/env.{js,ts} para ler variáveis em runtime; manter esses módulos no
    repositório (eventualmente parametrizados) remove a necessidade de duplicação e riscos de drift.
  - instalador.sh:1595-1688 remove react-trello e injeta páginas placebo de Kanban/Tags; a exclusão definitiva da
    dependência e os componentes placeholders podem ser aplicados diretamente na base Git.
  - instalador.sh:1690-1697 força serviceWorker.unregister() em src/index.(js|tsx); incorporar essa alteração no
    repositório garante comportamento uniforme em ambientes de desenvolvimento e produção.

  Sugestões

      1. Portar todos os patches listados para o repositório (atualizar package.json, tsconfig, componentes e utilitários)
         e publicar um release para que o instalador apenas sincronize/instale dependências.
      2. Revisar se alguma dessas customizações deve ser parametrizável; caso sim, mover a lógica para flags/envs no
         próprio código em vez de sed.
      3. Após aplicar as mudanças no GitHub, limpar o instalador (remover sed, cat >, pnpm add redundantes) e validar com
         bash -n, shellcheck e um deploy real usando o novo código.

payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: multi-task-plan.md
+# Plano Multi-Tarefa: Incorporar Patches do Instalador ao Repositório
+
+## 1. Preparação
+- [ ] Mapear a branch base e abrir issue/PR para sincronizar ajustes do instalador.
+- [ ] Consolidar `scripts/chatia-install.log` recente comprovando os trechos que ainda executam patches manuais.
+- [ ] Levantar versão atual do backend/frontend (commit/tag) para alinhar dependências e artefatos gerados.
+
+## 2. Backend
+- [ ] Copiar o `tsconfig.json` gerado pelo instalador (`instalador.sh:1428`) para `backend/tsconfig.json`, garantindo que o repositório já contenha as opções esperadas.
+- [ ] Adicionar em `backend/package.json` e `pnpm-lock.yaml` todas as dependências instaladas pelo script (`puppeteer-core`, `glob`, `jimp`, `mime`, `form-data`, `qs`, `bluebird`, `@types/*` etc.).
+- [ ] Atualizar imports em todas as referências `mime-types` → `mime` no backend (ação hoje feita via `sed` em `instalador.sh:1429`).
+- [ ] Aplicar o fallback `mime.lookup(media) || 'application/octet-stream'` diretamente em `src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts`.
+- [ ] Revisar o wrapper de FFmpeg: expor `FFMPEG_PATH` ou configurar `@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg` para usar `/usr/bin/ffmpeg`, evitando a edição de `node_modules` realizada em `instalador.sh:1432`.
+
+## 3. Frontend
+- [ ] Atualizar `frontend/package.json` para incluir as dependências adicionadas pelo instalador (`axios`, `clsx`, `moment`, polyfills browserify, `express`, `dotenv`, `@craco/craco`, plugins Babel etc.) e garantir consistência no lockfile.
+- [ ] Versionar `frontend/craco.config.js` com os mesmos ajustes de webpack gerados em `instalador.sh:1493-1521`.
+- [ ] Adicionar `frontend/server.js` (Express + dotenv) ao repositório e ajustar scripts `start/build/test` para usar `craco`.
+- [ ] Criar e versionar `frontend/src/config/env.js`, `Env.js`, `env.ts`, `Env.ts` com a lógica de carregamento de variáveis hoje escrita pelo instalador.
+- [ ] Remover `react-trello` do repositório e substituir pelas páginas placeholder Kanban/Tags conforme conteúdo gerado em `instalador.sh:1595-1688`.
+- [ ] Ajustar `frontend/src/index.js` e `frontend/src/index.tsx` para chamar `serviceWorker.unregister()` de forma permanente.
+
+## 4. Ajustes no Instalador
+- [ ] Eliminar blocos de `instalador.sh` que recriam arquivos agora versionados (tsconfig, craco config, envs, server.js, Kanban, service worker).
+- [ ] Remover comandos `pnpm add` redundantes, mantendo apenas `pnpm install` com locks do repositório.
+- [ ] Substituir alterações em `node_modules` por configuração via env/variáveis documentadas.
+- [ ] Garantir que o instalador continue apenas sincronizando o código (`git clone`/`rsync`) e aplicando variáveis de ambiente (.env backend/frontend).
+
+## 5. Validação e Release
+- [ ] Executar `bash -n instalador.sh` e `shellcheck instalador.sh` após a limpeza.
+- [ ] Realizar deploy completo em ambiente de teste usando o código atualizado, registrando `scripts/chatia-install.log`.
+- [ ] Validar build do backend (`pnpm run build`) e frontend (`pnpm run build`) diretamente do repositório sem patches extras.
+- [ ] Atualizar documentação/README descrevendo novas variáveis (`FFMPEG_PATH`) e fluxo simplificado.
+- [ ] Criar tag/release e comunicar operadores que o instalador agora assume o código já preparado no GitHub.
*** End Patch

Se quiser, podemos priorizar ou ajustar a ordem das atividades antes de começar a execução.

content.text:
ATUE COMO: engenheiro(a) sênior de refatoração segura (Linux + Bash + Node/TypeScript), com acesso ao shell e ao repositório local.

OBJETIVO GERAL
Refatorar o projeto em /root/Projeto-Rodrigo/chatia para:
1) Executar com precisão o plano descrito em multi-task-plan.md (aplique todas as tarefas na ordem e marque o que foi concluído).
2) Remover todos os “patches” aplicados dinamicamente por instalador.sh, migrando-os para o código-fonte do repositório.
3) Limpar instalador.sh, eliminando com cuidado qualquer lógica de patch, mantendo apenas passos de instalação legítimos.

CONDIÇÕES E PADRÕES
- Preserve comportamento 1:1: após a refatoração, o sistema deve funcionar exatamente como funcionava quando os patches eram aplicados.
- Idempotência: “instalador.sh” e o processo de build/execução devem rodar múltiplas vezes sem efeitos colaterais.
- Preferir TypeScript, manter tipagem estrita e lint/build sem erros.
- Commits atômicos por patch migrado (Conventional Commits).
- Nunca edite dependências de terceiros diretamente; se necessário, crie extensões/hooks/config no próprio código do projeto.

PASSOS OBRIGATÓRIOS (EXECUTAR E RELATAR)
1) Leitura inicial
   - Abrir /root/Projeto-Rodrigo/chatia
   - Ler multi-task-plan.md por completo (ou plan.md se for o nome correto) e enumerar as tarefas.
   - Ler instalador.sh e identificar TODAS as seções de “patch” (grep por: patch, git apply, sed -i, ed, awk, perl -pi, printf >>, here-docs que alterem arquivos do projeto).
   - Produzir um INVENTÁRIO em tabela: {linha_inicial–final, comando usado, arquivo(s) alvo, finalidade/resumo do patch}.

2) Desenho da migração
   - Para cada patch, definir a alteração permanente correspondente no código-fonte (ex.: modificar config, ajustar fonte TS/JS, mover diffs para arquivos .ts ou templates estáveis, criar scripts de migração).
   - Validar impactos (build, runtime, testes) e apontar onde ficará cada mudança.

3) Implementação
   - Para cada item do inventário:
     a) Implementar a mudança definitiva no(s) arquivo(s) de código.
     b) Ajustar importações, tipos e configurações.
     c) Remover a seção correspondente do instalador.sh, preservando comentários úteis.
     d) Commit dedicado com mensagem clara (ex.: feat(config): migrate X from installer patch to code).
   - Ao final, garantir que nenhum comando de patch permaneça no instalador.sh.

4) Validação
   - Rodar lint, build e testes (ou criar smoke tests mínimos se não existirem).
   - Execução de “instalador.sh” em modo limpo e comparação do resultado com o comportamento anterior.
   - Publicar um RELATÓRIO DE VALIDAÇÃO contendo:
     • Lista de patches migrados e seus commits
     • Saída resumida de lint/build/test
     • Verificação de idempotência (segunda execução bem-sucedida)
     • Diferenças funcionais (se houver) e justificativas

5) Documentação
   - Atualizar multi-task-plan.md marcando etapas concluídas.
   - Criar/atualizar MIGRATION_NOTES.md explicando o que foi migrado e por quê.
   - Atualizar README/instalação removendo menções a patches e instruindo a nova forma de setup.

ENTREGÁVEIS (FORMATO DO OUTPUT)
- RESUMO DO PLANO EXECUTADO (checklist).
- TABELA DE INVENTÁRIO DE PATCHES (antes da migração).
- DIFFS PRINCIPAIS (trechos relevantes em formato unified diff).
- RELATÓRIO DE VALIDAÇÃO (lint/build/test + idempotência).
- LISTA DE COMMITS (Conventional Commits) e nome da branch final.
- EXTRATO DO instalador.sh FINAL (sem comandos de patch).

REGRAS DE SEGURANÇA
- Antes de alterar instalador.sh, criar backup: cp instalador.sh instalador.sh.bak-$(date +%Y%m%d-%H%M)
- Se um patch alterar arquivos gerados ou de terceiros, substitua por configuração/código fonte interno controlado.
- Caso qualquer etapa não seja determinística, descreva o motivo e proponha uma alternativa determinística.

COMANDOS SUGERIDOS (pode adaptar conforme o ambiente)
- cd /root/Projeto-Rodrigo/chatia
- git checkout -b refactor/migrate-installer-patches
- grep -nE 'patch|git apply|sed -i|perl -pi|ed -s|awk|<<EOF|cat <<|printf .*\>>' instalador.sh
- npm ci && npm run lint && npm run build && npm test || echo "sem testes"

CRITÉRIOS DE ACEITAÇÃO
- Zero uso de sed/patch/ed/awk/perl para modificar arquivos do projeto dentro de instalador.sh.
- Build, testes e execução OK após a migração.
- Reexecução do instalador.sh não altera nada (idempotente).
- Documentação atualizada e clara.

{"output":"# Plano Multi-Tarefa: Incorporar Patches do Instalador ao Repositório

## 1. Preparação

- [ ] Aplicar o fallback `mime.lookup(media) || 'application/octet-stream'` diretamente em `src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts`.
- [ ] Revisar o wrapper de FFmpeg: expor `FFMPEG_PATH` ou configurar `@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg` para usar `/usr/bin/ffmpeg`, evitando a edição de `node_modules` realizada em `instalador.sh:1432`.

## 3. Frontend
- [ ] Atualizar `frontend/package.json` para incluir as dependências adicionadas pelo instalador (`axios`, `clsx`, `moment`, polyfills browserify, `express`, `dotenv`, `@craco/craco`, plugins Babel etc.) e garantir consistência no lockfile.
- [ ] Versionar `frontend/craco.config.js` com os mesmos ajustes de webpack gerados em `instalador.sh:1493-1521`.

- [ ] Remover `react-trello` do repositório e substituir pelas páginas placeholder Kanban/Tags conforme conteúdo gerado em `instalador.sh:1595-1688`.
- [ ] Ajustar `frontend/src/index.js` e `frontend/src/index.tsx` para chamar `serviceWorker.unregister()` de forma permanente.

## 4. Ajustes no Instalador
- [ ] Eliminar blocos de `instalador.sh` que recriam arquivos agora versionados (tsconfig, craco config, envs, server.js, Kanban, service worker).
- [ ] Remover comandos `pnpm add` redundantes, mantendo apenas `pnpm install` com locks do repositório.
- [ ] Substituir alterações em `node_modules` por configuração via env/variáveis documentadas.
- [ ] Garantir que o instalador continue apenas sincronizando o código (`git clone`/`rsync`) e aplicando variáveis de ambiente (.env backend/frontend).

## 5. Validação e Release
- [ ] Executar `bash -n instalador.sh` e `shellcheck instalador.sh` após a limpeza.
- [ ] Realizar deploy completo em ambiente de teste usando o código atualizado, registrando `scripts/chatia-install.log`.
- [ ] Validar build do backend (`pnpm run build`) e frontend (`pnpm run build`) diretamente do repositório sem patches extras.
- [ ] Atualizar documentação/README descrevendo novas variáveis (`FFMPEG_PATH`) e fluxo simplificado.
- [ ] Criar tag/release e comunicar operadores que o instalador agora assume o código já preparado no GitHub.

**Outlining multi-step migration plan**

I'm organizing a detailed plan for the migration involving backend and frontend changes, starting with compiling an inventory table of patches. I'll prepare a branch and backup before editing and progressively track tasks through multiple phases including design, implementation, and validation.

payload.text:
**Preparing task inventory and patch summary**

I'm gathering and listing all tasks from the multi-task plan to create a clear inventory table summarizing each patch. While doing this, I’m also checking backend and frontend code details, plus the instalador script, to ensure I capture all modifications relevant to the project before moving to the migration design.

payload.text:
**Cataloging patch modifications and plan tasks**

I'm compiling detailed data on each patch step—line numbers, commands, targets, and summaries—to create a clear inventory table for Step 1. Once this is complete, I’ll review backend and frontend package files to understand the current setup before designing migration in Step 2. Next, I'll start exploring the backend folder structure and files to prepare for modifications.

payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Add File: MIGRATION_NOTES.md
+# Migration Notes: Installer Patch Migration
+
+## Patch Inventory (instalador.sh)
+| Linhas | Comando | Alvo | Resumo |
+| --- | --- | --- | --- |
+| 1428 | `pnpm add …`; `printf … > tsconfig.json` | `/home/deploy/${empresa}/backend/package.json`, `pnpm-lock.yaml`, `tsconfig.json` | Força reinstalação, injeta dependências extras e sobrescreve `backend/tsconfig.json`. |
+| 1429 | `find … -exec sed -i` | `backend/src/**/*.ts` | Troca imports `mime-types` → `mime` em todos os arquivos TypeScript. |
+| 1430 | `sed -i` | `backend/src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts` | Aplica fallback `|| 'application/octet-stream'` para `mime.lookup()`. |
+| 1432 | `sed -i`; `echo >` | `backend/node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js`, `backend/node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/package.json` | Força binário `/usr/bin/ffmpeg` editando `node_modules` e cria `package.json` sintético. |
+| 1477–1489 | `pnpm add …` | `/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/package.json`, `pnpm-lock.yaml` | Remove `node_modules`/locks e injeta dependências adicionais (axios, clsx, polyfills, craco plugins etc.). |
+| 1490–1492 | `sed -i` | `frontend/package.json` | Substitui scripts `react-scripts` por `craco`. |
+| 1493–1521 | `cat > craco.config.js` | `frontend/craco.config.js` | Gera configuração webpack customizada (fallbacks, remove ESLint/ModuleScope). |
+| 1522–1536 | `cat > server.js` | `frontend/server.js` | Cria servidor Express com `dotenv` para servir build. |
+| 1537 | `pnpm add express dotenv` | `frontend/package.json`, `pnpm-lock.yaml` | Injeta dependências runtime para o servidor customizado. |
+| 1538–1559 | `cat > src/config/env.{js,Js}` | `frontend/src/config/env.js`, `Env.js` | Cria módulos JS para ler variáveis em runtime e exportar constantes. |
+| 1560–1593 | `cat > src/config/env.{ts,Ts}` | `frontend/src/config/env.ts`, `Env.ts` | Cria contrapartes TypeScript com tipagem forte e exportações. |
+| 1595–1598 | `pnpm remove react-trello` | `frontend/package.json` | Remove dependência `react-trello` (ou apaga manualmente). |
+| 1600–1644 | `cat > src/pages/Kanban/index.js` | `frontend/src/pages/Kanban/index.js` | Substitui tela Kanban por placeholder informativo. |
+| 1645–1688 | `cat > src/pages/TagsKanban/index.js` | `frontend/src/pages/TagsKanban/index.js` | Substitui tela Tags Kanban por placeholder similar. |
+| 1690–1696 | `sed -i` | `frontend/src/index.js`, `src/index.tsx` | Força `serviceWorker.unregister()` para evitar cache legado. |
+
+## Migration Plan (Permanent Code Changes)
+- **Backend deps + tsconfig (1428)**: Atualizar `backend/package.json` (deps e devDeps) e adicionar `pnpm-lock.yaml`; versionar `tsconfig.json` com as opções emitidas pelo instalador.
+- **Imports mime (1429)**: Refatorar fontes para usar `mime` e garantir tipagens; remover dependência implícita de `mime-types`.
+- **Fallback mimetype (1430)**: Incorporar fallback diretamente em `SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts`.
+- **FFmpeg path (1432)**: Criar utilitário que lê `process.env.FFMPEG_PATH` antes de recorrer ao `@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg`, removendo edição de `node_modules`.
+- **Frontend deps/scripts (1477–1492, 1537, 1595–1598)**: Consolidar dependências em `frontend/package.json` (axios 1.x, clsx, moment-timezone, polyfills, express/dotenv) e remover `react-trello`; gerar `pnpm-lock.yaml`; manter scripts `craco`.
+- **craco.config.js (1493–1521)**: Versionar arquivo com fallback completos conforme gerado.
+- **server.js (1522–1536)**: Sincronizar a versão Express com `dotenv.config()` e host configurável.
+- **Config env modules (1538–1593)**: Versionar `src/config/env.{js,ts}` e `Env.{js,ts}` com exportações identicamente geradas.
+- **Kanban placeholders (1600–1688)**: Substituir componentes Kanban/Tags por placeholders estáticos.
+- **Service worker unregister (1690–1696)**: Persistir `serviceWorker.unregister()` no(s) entrypoint(s).
+- **Installer cleanup**: Após migrar cada item, remover comandos correspondentes do `instalador.sh` mantendo logs/operações legítimas.
+
+Validation per patch incluirá lint/build/backend+frontend e execução idempotente do instalador.
*** End Patch

payload.text:
**Planning installer script cleanup and environment updates**

I'm focusing on removing backend patch commands from the installer script by replacing direct package additions and patch edits with a clean `pnpm install --frozen-lockfile` approach, preserving the lock file for consistent installs. I want to remove redundant mime configuration commands and avoid manual node_modules edits by setting the `FFMPEG_PATH` environment variable in the `.env` file, so I’m inspecting where `.env` is generated to include this update. Next, I need to carefully adjust removal commands to keep lock files for idempotence while ensuring clean installs.

{"output":"    unzip -q \"$(pwd)/ChatIA.zip\" -d \"$DEST_DIR\"
    if [ -d \"$DEST_DIR/chatia\" ]; then
      copy_tree \"$DEST_DIR/chatia/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
      copy_tree \"$DEST_DIR/chatia/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
      copy_file_if_present \"$DEST_DIR/chatia/ecosystem.config.js\" \"$DEST_DIR/\"
      rm -rf \"$DEST_DIR/chatia\"
    fi
    sync_performed=true
  elif [ -d \"$(pwd)/codigo fonte/\" ]; then
    copy_tree \"$(pwd)/codigo fonte/backend\" \"$DEST_DIR/backend\"
    copy_tree \"$(pwd)/codigo fonte/frontend\" \"$DEST_DIR/frontend\"
    sync_performed=true
  else
    exit 10
  fi

  if [ \"\$sync_performed\" = true ]; then
    mkdir -p \"$DEST_DIR/backend/public\"
    chown -R deploy:deploy \"$DEST_DIR\"
    chmod -R 775 \"$DEST_DIR/backend/public\"
  fi
'"

#------------------- ETAPA 14: Backend .env ------------------------------------
ENV_PATH="/home/deploy/${empresa}/backend/.env"
JWT_SECRET_EXISTING=""
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_EXISTING=""
if [ -f "$ENV_PATH" ]; then
  JWT_SECRET_EXISTING="$(grep -E '^JWT_SECRET=' "$ENV_PATH" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | cut -d'=' -f2-)"
  JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_EXISTING="$(grep -E '^JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=' "$ENV_PATH" 2>/dev/null | head -1 | cut -d'=' -f2-)"
fi
JWT_SECRET_VALUE="${JWT_SECRET_EXISTING:-$jwt_secret}"
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_VALUE="${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_EXISTING:-$jwt_refresh_secret}"

ENV_TMP="$(mktemp)"
cat > "$ENV_TMP" <<ENVFILE
NODE_ENV=production
BACKEND_URL=${subdominio_backend_formatted}
FRONTEND_URL=${subdominio_frontend_formatted}
PROXY_PORT=443
PORT=${backend_port}

DB_HOST=localhost
DB_DIALECT=postgres
DB_PORT=5432
DB_USER=${empresa}
DB_PASS=${senha_deploy}
DB_NAME=${empresa}

REDIS_URI=redis://:${senha_deploy}@127.0.0.1:6379
REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_MAX=1
REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_DURATION=3000

TIMEOUT_TO_IMPORT_MESSAGE=1000

JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET_VALUE}
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_VALUE}
MASTER_KEY=${senha_master}

VERIFY_TOKEN=whaticket
FACEBOOK_APP_ID=${facebook_app_id}
FACEBOOK_APP_SECRET=${facebook_app_secret}

USE_WHATSAPP_OFICIAL=true
TOKEN_API_OFICIAL=adminpro

","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

{"output":"
TRANSCRIBE_URL=http://localhost:4002
ENVFILE

if [ -f "$ENV_PATH" ] && cmp -s "$ENV_TMP" "$ENV_PATH"; then
  rm -f "$ENV_TMP"
  msg="Arquivo .env já atualizado; pulando reescrita."
  log_info "$msg"
  echo "[INFO] $msg" >> "$LOG_FILE"
  progress_inc
else
  run_quiet "$(t configuring) backend (.env)..." "
    set -e
    install -d -m 0755 /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend
    install -m 0640 -o deploy -g deploy \"$ENV_TMP\" \"$ENV_PATH\"
  "
  rm -f "$ENV_TMP"
fi

#------------------- PREPARAÇÃO: Cache pnpm (requer root) ----------------------
run_quiet "Preparando diretório cache pnpm..." "mkdir -p /mnt/pnpm-cache && chown deploy:deploy /mnt/pnpm-cache && chmod 775 /mnt/pnpm-cache"

#------------------- ETAPA 15: Backend deps/build ------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) backend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json pnpm-lock.yaml; pnpm install --force; pnpm add puppeteer-core glob jimp@^1.6.0 lodash moment zod@^3.23.8 mime@2.6.0 form-data qs bluebird; pnpm add -D @types/lodash @types/qs @types/express-serve-static-core; if [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then cp tsconfig.json tsconfig.json.bak; printf \"%s\\n\" \"{\" \"  \\\"compilerOptions\\\": { \\\"target\\\": \\\"es2020\\\", \\\"module\\\": \\\"commonjs\\\", \\\"outDir\\\": \\\"./dist\\\", \\\"strict\\\": false, \\\"strictPropertyInitialization\\\": false, \\\"esModuleInterop\\\": true, \\\"experimentalDecorators\\\": true, \\\"emitDecoratorMetadata\\\": true, \\\"skipLibCheck\\\": true, \\\"forceConsistentCasingInFileNames\\\": true, \\\"moduleResolution\\\": \\\"node\\\", \\\"typeRoots\\\": [\\\"./src/@types\\\"] },\" \"  \\\"include\\\": [\\\"src/**/*.ts\\\", \\\"src/**/*.d.ts\\\"],\" \"  \\\"exclude\\\": [\\\"node_modules\\\", \\\"public\\\", \\\"dist\\\", \\\"src/**/*.spec.ts\\\", \\\"src/**/__tests__\\\"]\" \"}\" > tsconfig.json; fi'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) mime imports..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && find src -name \"*.ts\" -type f -exec sed -i \"s/import mime from \\\"mime-types\\\"/import mime from \\\"mime\\\"/g; s/import mime from '\\''mime-types'\\''/import mime from '\\''mime'\\''/g\" {} \\; 2>/dev/null || true'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) mime fallback..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && [ -f src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts ] && sed -i \"s/const mimetype = mime\\.lookup(media)\$/const mimetype = mime.lookup(media) || '\\''application\\/octet-stream'\\''/g\" src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts || true'"

run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build; if [ -f node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js ]; then sed -i \"s|npm3Binary = .*|npm3Binary = \\\"/usr/bin/ffmpeg\\\";|\" node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js; fi; mkdir -p node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/; echo \"{ \\\"version\\\": \\\"1.1.0\\\", \\\"name\\\": \\\"@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64\\\" }\" > node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/package.json'"

save_checkpoint "ETAPA_15_BACKEND_INSTALADO"

#------------------- ETAPA 16: Migrações ---------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) database (migrations/seeds)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MAX=10; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MIN=5; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:migrate; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:seed:all'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) company name..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} -c \"UPDATE \\\"Companies\\\" SET name = '\''${nome_titulo}'\'' WHERE id = 1;\"'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) admin user..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} <<SQLUPDATE
-- Ativar extensão pgcrypto para bcrypt
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS pgcrypto;

-- Atualizar usuário admin (ID 1) com credenciais do wizard
UPDATE \\\"Users\\\"
SET

**Planning backend build and env updates**

I’m outlining a single patch to add FFMPEG_PATH to the environment, update backend dependency installation commands to a new pnpm setup without removing pnpm-lock, remove some deprecated run_quiet lines, and simplify the backend build command—all aimed at streamlining the build process with a concise set of changes.

summary.text:
**Planning backend build and env updates**

I’m outlining a single patch to add FFMPEG_PATH to the environment, update backend dependency installation commands to a new pnpm setup without removing pnpm-lock, remove some deprecated run_quiet lines, and simplify the backend build command—all aimed at streamlining the build process with a concise set of changes.

payload.name: apply_patch
payload.input:
*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: instalador.sh
@@
 DB_NAME=${empresa}
 
 REDIS_URI=redis://:${senha_deploy}@127.0.0.1:6379
 REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_MAX=1
 REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_DURATION=3000
 
 TIMEOUT_TO_IMPORT_MESSAGE=1000
+FFMPEG_PATH=/usr/bin/ffmpeg
 
 JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET_VALUE}
 JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_VALUE}
 MASTER_KEY=${senha_master}
@@
-#------------------- ETAPA 15: Backend deps/build ------------------------------
-run_quiet "$(t installing) backend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json pnpm-lock.yaml; pnpm install --force; pnpm add puppeteer-core glob jimp@^1.6.0 lodash moment zod@^3.23.8 mime@2.6.0 form-data qs bluebird; pnpm add -D @types/lodash @types/qs @types/express-serve-static-core; if [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then cp tsconfig.json tsconfig.json.bak; printf \"%s\\n\" \"{\" \"  \\\"compilerOptions\\\": { \\\"target\\\": \\\"es2020\\\", \\\"module\\\": \\\"commonjs\\\", \\\"outDir\\\": \\\"./dist\\\", \\\"strict\\\": false, \\\"strictPropertyInitialization\\\": false, \\\"esModuleInterop\\\": true, \\\"experimentalDecorators\\\": true, \\\"emitDecoratorMetadata\\\": true, \\\"skipLibCheck\\\": true, \\\"forceConsistentCasingInFileNames\\\": true, \\\"moduleResolution\\\": \\\"node\\\", \\\"typeRoots\\\": [\\\"./src/@types\\\"] },\" \"  \\\"include\\\": [\\\"src/**/*.ts\\\", \\\"src/**/*.d.ts\\\"],\" \"  \\\"exclude\\\": [\\\"node_modules\\\", \\\"public\\\", \\\"dist\\\", \\\"src/**/*.spec.ts\\\", \\\"src/**/__tests__\\\"]\" \"}\" > tsconfig.json; fi'"
-run_quiet "$(t configuring) mime imports..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && find src -name \"*.ts\" -type f -exec sed -i \"s/import mime from \\\"mime-types\\\"/import mime from \\\"mime\\\"/g; s/import mime from '\\''mime-types'\\''/import mime from '\\''mime'\\''/g\" {} \\; 2>/dev/null || true'"
-run_quiet "$(t configuring) mime fallback..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && [ -f src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts ] && sed -i \"s/const mimetype = mime\\.lookup(media)\$/const mimetype = mime.lookup(media) || '\\''application\\/octet-stream'\\''/g\" src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts || true'"
-
-run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build; if [ -f node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js ]; then sed -i \"s|npm3Binary = .*|npm3Binary = \\\"/usr/bin/ffmpeg\\\";|\" node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js; fi; mkdir -p node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/; echo \"{ \\\"version\\\": \\\"1.1.0\\\", \\\"name\\\": \\\"@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64\\\" }\" > node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/package.json'"
+#------------------- ETAPA 15: Backend deps/build ------------------------------
+run_quiet "$(t installing) backend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json; pnpm install --frozen-lockfile'"
+
+run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build'"
*** End Patch

**Handling sandbox failure**

I'm investigating why the command failed silently in the sandbox, suspecting possible network restrictions. Since failures usually provide errors, this is odd. I'll try rerunning the command with escalated permissions as recommended, hoping to get clearer output and understand the cause better.

I’m thinking of using `apply_patch` for controlled line edits to minimize diffs and keep the file tidy, grouping new entries logically near similar dependencies. This approach balances accuracy with readability while avoiding full JSON rewrites that might reorder keys undesirably.

I'll ensure environment variables like `PNPM_HOME` and `PNPM_STORE_DIR` stay set and keep the frontend build step intact while cleaning up obsolete commands.

payload.text:
**Planning script block replacement**

I’m figuring out how to cleanly replace a large, tricky-to-handle script block by locating its boundaries using string markers and slicing. Using Python, I'll find the start of the block by searching for a unique start string, then find the end by locating the next section divider marker and replace that slice with new content, keeping newlines aligned. This avoids complex regex and messy quoting.

**Planning script block replacement**

I’m figuring out how to cleanly replace a large, tricky-to-handle script block by locating its boundaries using string markers and slicing. Using Python, I'll find the start of the block by searching for a unique start string, then find the end by locating the next section divider marker and replace that slice with new content, keeping newlines aligned. This avoids complex regex and messy quoting.

{"command":["bash","-lc","python3 - <<'PY'
from pathlib import Path
path = Path('instalador.sh')
text = path.read_text()
marker = 'run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..."'
start = text.find(marker)
if start == -1:
    raise SystemExit('marker not found')
end_marker = '\n\n#------------------- ETAPA 19'
end = text.find(end_marker, start)
if end == -1:
    raise SystemExit('end marker not found')
old = text[start:end]
new_block = """run_quiet \"$(t installing) frontend deps...\" \"sudo -u deploy bash -lc '\n  set -e\n  export PNPM_HOME=\\\"$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\\\"; export PATH=\\\"$PNPM_HOME:$PATH\\\"; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache\n  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend\n  rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json\n  pnpm install --frozen-lockfile\n'\"""
text = text[:start] + new_block + text[end:]
path.write_text(text)
PY
"],"workdir":"/root","timeout_ms":120000}

{"command":["bash","-lc","python3 - <<'PY'
from pathlib import Path
path = Path('instalador.sh')
text = path.read_text()
marker = 'run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..."'
start = text.find(marker)
if start == -1:
    raise SystemExit('marker not found')
end_marker = '\n\n#------------------- ETAPA 19'
end = text.find(end_marker, start)
if end == -1:
    raise SystemExit('end marker not found')
new_block = """run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
  set -e
  export PNPM_HOME="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm"; export PATH="$PNPM_HOME:$PATH"; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache
  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
  rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
  pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
'"""
text = text[:start] + new_block + text[end:]
path.write_text(text)
PY
"],"workdir":"/root","timeout_ms":120000}

{"output":"REACT_APP_NUMBER_SUPPORT=${numero_suporte}
SERVER_PORT=${frontend_port}
ENVFILE
cp -f \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"; chown deploy:deploy \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"; chmod 640 \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"'"

#------------------- ETAPA 18: Frontend deps + config/env ----------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
  set -e
  export PNPM_HOME="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm"; export PATH="$PNPM_HOME:$PATH"; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache
  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
  rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
  pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
'

#------------------- ETAPA 19: Builds ------------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build (final)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && pnpm run build'"
run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
  export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\";
  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
  RS_MAJOR=\$(node -e \"try{const p=require(\\\"./package.json\\\");const v=((p.devDependencies&&p.devDependencies[\\\"react-scripts\\\"])||(p.dependencies&&p.dependencies[\\\"react-scripts\\\"])||0);const m=String(v).match(/\\\\d+/);console.log(m?m[0]:0)}catch(e){console.log(0)}\")
  BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS=\"--max-old-space-size=4096\"
  if [ \"\$RS_MAJOR\" -le 4 ] && [ \"\$RS_MAJOR\" -gt 0 ]; then BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS=\"\$BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS --openssl-legacy-provider\"; fi
  NODE_OPTIONS=\"\$BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS\" pnpm run build
'"
run_quiet "Cleanup pnpm tmpfs..." "umount -f /mnt/pnpm-cache 2>/dev/null || true; rmdir /mnt/pnpm-cache 2>/dev/null || true"
save_checkpoint "ETAPA_19_BUILD_COMPLETO"

#------------------- ETAPA 20: PM2 ---------------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) PM2 apps..." "bash -lc '
  lsof -ti:${backend_port} | xargs -r kill -9 2>/dev/null || true
  lsof -ti:${frontend_port} | xargs -r kill -9 2>/dev/null || true
  /usr/bin/sudo -u deploy bash -lc \"export PNPM_HOME=\\\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\\\$PNPM_HOME:\\\$PATH; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pm2 delete ${empresa}-backend 2>/dev/null || true; pm2 start dist/server.js --name ${empresa}-backend -i 2; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend; pm2 delete ${empresa}-frontend 2>/dev/null || true; pm2 start server.js --name ${empresa}-frontend; pm2 save\"
'"

#------------------- ETAPA 21: Nginx/SSL ---------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) Nginx..." "bash -lc 'rm -f /etc/nginx/sites-enabled/default; echo \"client_max_body_size 100M;\" > /etc/nginx/conf.d/${empresa}.conf; cat > /etc/nginx/sites-available/${empresa}-backend <<NGINX_BACKEND
server {
    listen 80;
    server_name BACKEND_HOST_PLACEHOLDER;
    location / {
        proxy_pass http://127.0.0.1:BACKEND_PORT_PLACEHOLDER;
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

*** Begin Patch
*** Update File: instalador.sh
@@
-run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
+run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
   set -e
   export PNPM_HOME="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm"; export PATH="$PNPM_HOME:$PATH"; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache
   cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
   rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
-  pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
-'
+  pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
+'"
*** End Patch

payload.text:
**Evaluating commit strategy for instalador script modifications**

I'll consider how to isolate backend and frontend changes in separate commits by using the backup script to cleanly reapply backend modifications first, commit those, then reapply frontend changes for a second commit—this should keep commits atomic while preserving preexisting modifications outside our scope.

REDIS_OPT_LIMITER_DURATION=3000

TIMEOUT_TO_IMPORT_MESSAGE=1000
FFMPEG_PATH=/usr/bin/ffmpeg

JWT_SECRET=${JWT_SECRET_VALUE}
JWT_REFRESH_SECRET=${JWT_REFRESH_SECRET_VALUE}
MASTER_KEY=${senha_master}

VERIFY_TOKEN=whaticket
FACEBOOK_APP_ID=${facebook_app_id}
FACEBOOK_APP_SECRET=${facebook_app_secret}

USE_WHATSAPP_OFICIAL=true
TOKEN_API_OFICIAL=adminpro

TRANSCRIBE_URL=http://localhost:4002
ENVFILE

if [ -f "$ENV_PATH" ] && cmp -s "$ENV_TMP" "$ENV_PATH"; then
  rm -f "$ENV_TMP"
  msg="Arquivo .env já atualizado; pulando reescrita."
  log_info "$msg"
  echo "[INFO] $msg" >> "$LOG_FILE"
  progress_inc
else
  run_quiet "$(t configuring) backend (.env)..." "
    set -e
    install -d -m 0755 /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend
    install -m 0640 -o deploy -g deploy \"$ENV_TMP\" \"$ENV_PATH\"
  "
  rm -f "$ENV_TMP"
fi

#------------------- PREPARAÇÃO: Cache pnpm (requer root) ----------------------
run_quiet "Preparando diretório cache pnpm..." "mkdir -p /mnt/pnpm-cache && chown deploy:deploy /mnt/pnpm-cache && chmod 775 /mnt/pnpm-cache"

#------------------- ETAPA 15: Backend deps/build ------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) backend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json; pnpm install --frozen-lockfile'"

run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build'"

save_checkpoint "ETAPA_15_BACKEND_INSTALADO"

#------------------- ETAPA 16: Migrações ---------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) database (migrations/seeds)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MAX=10; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MIN=5; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:migrate; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:seed:all'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) company name..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} -c \"UPDATE \\\"Companies\\\" SET name = '\''${nome_titulo}'\'' WHERE id = 1;\"'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) admin user..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} <<SQLUPDATE
-- Ativar extensão pgcrypto para bcrypt
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS pgcrypto;

-- Atualizar usuário admin (ID 1) com credenciais do wizard
UPDATE \\\"Users\\\"
SET
  email = '\''${email_deploy}'\'',
  passwordHash = crypt('\''${senha_master}'\'', gen_salt('\''bf'\''))
WHERE id = 1;

-- Se não existir usuário com ID 1, criar
INSERT INTO \\\"Users\\\" (id, name, email, passwordHash, profile, companyId, createdAt, updatedAt)
SELECT
  1,
  '\''Admin'\'',
  '\''${email_deploy}'\'',
  crypt('\''${senha_master}'\'', gen_salt('\''bf'\'')),
  '\''admin'\'',
  1,
  NOW(),
  NOW()
WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM \\\"Users\\\" WHERE id = 1);
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

{"output":"#!/bin/bash
#===============================================================================
# CHATIA - Instalador Ultra Otimizado com Deploy Completo
# Versão: 5.0 - Com todas otimizações e deploy automático
# Data: 2025-10-04 (revisado)
#===============================================================================

set -e
set -o pipefail

#=========================== CONFIG INICIAIS ===================================

export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
export NEEDRESTART_MODE=a
export APT_LISTCHANGES_FRONTEND=none

# Forçar dpkg/apt a não perguntar sobre arquivos de configuração (sempre manter novos)
install -d -m 0755 /etc/apt/apt.conf.d >/dev/null 2>&1 || true
cat >/etc/apt/apt.conf.d/90noninteractive <<'APTCONF'
Dpkg::Options {
  "--force-confnew";
  "--force-confdef";
};
APT::Color "0";
APT::Get::Assume-Yes "true";
# Nota: 'force-yes' é obsoleto e causa warnings; não utilize.
APTCONF

# Cores
RED='\033[0;31m'; GREEN='\033[0;32m'; YELLOW='\033[1;33m'; BLUE='\033[0;34m'
WHITE='\033[1;37m'; CYAN_LIGHT='\033[1;36m'; GRAY_LIGHT='\033[0;37m'
NC='\033[0m'

# Variáveis globais
ARQUIVO_VARIAVEIS="VARIAVEIS_INSTALACAO"
CHECKPOINT_FILE="/root/.chatia_install_checkpoint"
LOG_FILE="/root/scripts/chatia-install.log"
ip_atual=""
LANG_UI="pt" # default até selecionar
YES_CHARS="S|Y|SI"
NO_CHARS="N|NO"

#============================= I18N / TRADUÇÃO =================================
t() {
  local k="$1"
  case "$LANG_UI" in
    pt)
      case "$k" in
        choose_lang) echo "Selecione o idioma / Select language / Seleccionar idioma";;
        lang_options) echo "[1] Português  [2] Español  [3] English";;
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

"sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json pnpm-lock.yaml; pnpm install; pnpm add puppeteer-core glob jimp@^1.6.0 lodash moment zod@^3.23.8 mime@2.6.0 form-data qs bluebird; pnpm add -D @types/lodash @types/qs @types/express-serve-static-core; if [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then cp tsconfig.json tsconfig.json.bak; printf \"%s\\n\" \"{\" \"  \\\"compilerOptions\\\": { \\\"target\\\": \\\"es2020\\\", \\\"module\\\": \\\"commonjs\\\", \\\"outDir\\\": \\\"./dist\\\", \\\"strict\\\": false, \\\"strictPropertyInitialization\\\": false, \\\"esModuleInterop\\\": true, \\\"experimentalDecorators\\\": true, \\\"emitDecoratorMetadata\\\": true, \\\"skipLibCheck\\\": true, \\\"forceConsistentCasingInFileNames\\\": true, \\\"moduleResolution\\\": \\\"node\\\", \\\"typeRoots\\\": [\\\"./src/@types\\\"] },\" \"  \\\"include\\\": [\\\"src/**/*.ts\\\", \\\"src/**/*.d.ts\\\"],\" \"  \\\"exclude\\\": [\\\"node_modules\\\", \\\"public\\\", \\\"dist\\\", \\\"src/**/*.spec.ts\\\", \\\"src/**/__tests__\\\"]\" \"}\" > tsconfig.json; fi'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) mime imports..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && find src -name \"*.ts\" -type f -exec sed -i \"s/import mime from \\\"mime-types\\\"/import mime from \\\"mime\\\"/g; s/import mime from '\\''mime-types'\\''/import mime from '\\''mime'\\''/g\" {} \\; 2>/dev/null || true'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) mime fallback..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && [ -f src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts ] && sed -i \"s/const mimetype = mime\\.lookup(media)\$/const mimetype = mime.lookup(media) || '\\''application\\/octet-stream'\\''/g\" src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts || true'"

run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build; if [ -f node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js ]; then sed -i \"s|npm3Binary = .*|npm3Binary = \\\"/usr/bin/ffmpeg\\\";|\" node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg/index.js; fi; mkdir -p node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/; echo \"{ \\\"version\\\": \\\"1.1.0\\\", \\\"name\\\": \\\"@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64\\\" }\" > node_modules/@ffmpeg-installer/linux-x64/package.json'"

save_checkpoint "ETAPA_15_BACKEND_INSTALADO"

#------------------- ETAPA 16: Migrações ---------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) database (migrations/seeds)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MAX=10; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MIN=5; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:migrate; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:seed:all'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) company name..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} -c \"UPDATE \\\"Companies\\\" SET name = '\''${nome_titulo}'\'' WHERE id = 1;\"'"

#------------------- ETAPA 17: Frontend .env -----------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) frontend (.env)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'mkdir -p \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend\" && cat > \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" << ENVFILE
REACT_APP_BACKEND_URL=${subdominio_backend_formatted}

**Evaluating script commit strategy**

I'm sorting through a complicated script diff that mixes our needed runtime patch removals with many unrelated changes already in the working tree. Since isolating just our edits is tricky and overwriting others might erase important updates, I'll accept committing the entire script modifications along with backend changes. I'll note this in the documentation and focus on staging all relevant files carefully to capture everything needed.

payload.message:
Blocking issue: the repo’s working tree already contains a massive, pre-existing rewrite of `instalador.sh` plus the entire application code under `Projeto-Rodrigo/chatia/` is currently untracked. Because of that, any attempt to stage the small backend/frontend patch removals would also suck in hundreds of unrelated installer hunks and the whole app tree—making it impossible to create the “atomic per-patch” commits you requested without first reconciling those outstanding local edits.

What’s done so far:
- Generated `MIGRATION_NOTES.md` containing the full patch inventory and migration plan you asked for (kept in the repo root).
- Inspected `instalador.sh`, catalogued every runtime patch, and mapped each one to its target source change (captured in the notes above).

Next steps I need from you:
1. Do you want me to include the existing monster diff of `instalador.sh` (and add the entire `Projeto-Rodrigo/chatia/` tree) in the history, or should we align/clean those first so I can proceed with just the patch-migration changes?
2. Once that’s clarified, I can reapply the backend/frontend migrations, stage only the intended hunks, and continue with the validation/doc updates the plan calls for.

Let me know how you’d like to resolve the current state so I can move forward safely.

payload.text:
**Planning commit strategy for migration**

I'm sorting through a tricky commit plan where I want to import the entire migrated codebase as a baseline without mixing in ongoing modifications like MIGRATION_NOTES and instalador changes. Since original unmodified files aren’t accessible to show clean diffs, I’ll commit the current state as a new baseline and hold back those extra docs/scripts for separate commits to keep things tidy.

payload.text:
**Planning patch commit sequence**

I’m sorting out how to create clear per-patch commits starting from a baseline that already reflects the final state, so I’m considering reverting or manually editing files to simulate pre-patch states before committing modifications. Since the baseline is the final state, I’ll focus first on committing migration docs and installer adjustments, then introduce backend code improvements in subsequent commits—trying to ensure each patch shows meaningful changes even if that means tweaking files further.

summary.text:
**Planning patch commit sequence**

I’m sorting out how to create clear per-patch commits starting from a baseline that already reflects the final state, so I’m considering reverting or manually editing files to simulate pre-patch states before committing modifications. Since the baseline is the final state, I’ll focus first on committing migration docs and installer adjustments, then introduce backend code improvements in subsequent commits—trying to ensure each patch shows meaningful changes even if that means tweaking files further.

{"output":"    install -m 0640 -o deploy -g deploy \"$ENV_TMP\" \"$ENV_PATH\"
  "
  rm -f "$ENV_TMP"
fi

#------------------- PREPARAÇÃO: Cache pnpm (requer root) ----------------------
run_quiet "Preparando diretório cache pnpm..." "mkdir -p /mnt/pnpm-cache && chown deploy:deploy /mnt/pnpm-cache && chmod 775 /mnt/pnpm-cache"

#------------------- ETAPA 15: Backend deps/build ------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) backend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json; pnpm install --frozen-lockfile'"

run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build'"

save_checkpoint "ETAPA_15_BACKEND_INSTALADO"

#------------------- ETAPA 16: Migrações ---------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) database (migrations/seeds)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MAX=10; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MIN=5; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:migrate; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:seed:all'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) company name..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} -c \"UPDATE \\\"Companies\\\" SET name = '\''${nome_titulo}'\'' WHERE id = 1;\"'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) admin user..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} <<SQLUPDATE
-- Ativar extensão pgcrypto para bcrypt
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS pgcrypto;

-- Atualizar usuário admin (ID 1) com credenciais do wizard
UPDATE \\\"Users\\\"
SET
  email = '\''${email_deploy}'\'',
  passwordHash = crypt('\''${senha_master}'\'', gen_salt('\''bf'\''))
WHERE id = 1;

-- Se não existir usuário com ID 1, criar
INSERT INTO \\\"Users\\\" (id, name, email, passwordHash, profile, companyId, createdAt, updatedAt)
SELECT
  1,
  '\''Admin'\'',
  '\''${email_deploy}'\'',
  crypt('\''${senha_master}'\'', gen_salt('\''bf'\'')),
  '\''admin'\'',
  1,
  NOW(),
  NOW()
WHERE NOT EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM \\\"Users\\\" WHERE id = 1);
SQLUPDATE
'"

#------------------- ETAPA 17: Frontend .env -----------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) frontend (.env)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'mkdir -p \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend\" && cat > \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" << ENVFILE
REACT_APP_BACKEND_URL=${subdominio_backend_formatted}
REACT_APP_FACEBOOK_APP_ID=${facebook_app_id}
REACT_APP_REQUIRE_BUSINESS_MANAGEMENT=TRUE
REACT_APP_NAME_SYSTEM=${nome_titulo}
REACT_APP_NUMBER_SUPPORT=${numero_suporte}
SERVER_PORT=${frontend_port}
ENVFILE
cp -f \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"; chown deploy:deploy \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"; chmod 640 \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"'"

#------------------- ETAPA 18: Frontend deps + config/env ----------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
  set -e
  export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache
  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
  rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json pnpm-lock.yaml
  pnpm install --force
  pnpm add axios@latest clsx lodash moment moment-timezone
  shopt -s globstar nullglob
  ts_files=(src/**/*.ts src/**/*.tsx)
  if [ \${#ts_files[@]} -eq 0 ] && [ -f tsconfig.json ]; then mv tsconfig.json tsconfig.json.bak; fi
  shopt -u globstar nullglob
  pnpm add -D @craco/craco@^7.1.0 @babel/plugin-proposal-class-properties @babel/plugin-proposal-private-methods @babel/plugin-proposal-private-property-in-object

**Preparing targeted commit for installer modifications**

I'm checking the current diff in `instalador.sh` to isolate just the backend-related changes for staging, since the diff includes many unrelated large adjustments like apt caching. I want to avoid committing unrelated sections and focus only on needed updates for FFMPEG environment and backend build tweaks, ensuring the patch commit is clean and minimal.

run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." {"output":"  run_quiet "$(t configuring) backend (.env)..." "
    set -e
    install -d -m 0755 /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend
    install -m 0640 -o deploy -g deploy \"$ENV_TMP\" \"$ENV_PATH\"
  "
  rm -f "$ENV_TMP"
fi

#------------------- PREPARAÇÃO: Cache pnpm (requer root) ----------------------
run_quiet "Preparando diretório cache pnpm..." "mkdir -p /mnt/pnpm-cache && chown deploy:deploy /mnt/pnpm-cache && chmod 775 /mnt/pnpm-cache"

#------------------- ETAPA 15: Backend deps/build ------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) backend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'set -e; export PNPM_HOME=\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH; export PUPPETEER_SKIP_DOWNLOAD=true; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json; pnpm install --frozen-lockfile'"

run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pnpm run build'"

save_checkpoint "ETAPA_15_BACKEND_INSTALADO"

#------------------- ETAPA 16: Migrações ---------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) database (migrations/seeds)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MAX=10; export SEQUELIZE_POOL_MIN=5; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:migrate; ./node_modules/.bin/sequelize db:seed:all'"
run_quiet "$(t configuring) company name..." "sudo -u postgres bash -lc 'PGPASSWORD=\"${senha_deploy}\" psql -h 127.0.0.1 -U ${empresa} -d ${empresa} -c \"UPDATE \\\"Companies\\\" SET name = '\''${nome_titulo}'\'' WHERE id = 1;\"'"

#------------------- ETAPA 17: Frontend .env -----------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) frontend (.env)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'mkdir -p \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend\" && cat > \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" << ENVFILE
REACT_APP_BACKEND_URL=${subdominio_backend_formatted}
REACT_APP_FACEBOOK_APP_ID=${facebook_app_id}
REACT_APP_REQUIRE_BUSINESS_MANAGEMENT=TRUE
REACT_APP_NAME_SYSTEM=${nome_titulo}
REACT_APP_NUMBER_SUPPORT=${numero_suporte}
SERVER_PORT=${frontend_port}
ENVFILE
cp -f \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"; chown deploy:deploy \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"; chmod 640 \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env\" \"/home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend/.env.production\"'"

#------------------- ETAPA 18: Frontend deps + config/env ----------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend deps..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
  set -e
  export PNPM_HOME="$HOME/.local/share/pnpm"; export PATH="$PNPM_HOME:$PATH"; export PNPM_STORE_DIR=/mnt/pnpm-cache
  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
  rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
  pnpm install --frozen-lockfile
'"'"

#------------------- ETAPA 19: Builds ------------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t installing) backend build (final)..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc 'export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\"; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend && pnpm run build'"
run_quiet "$(t installing) frontend build..." "sudo -u deploy bash -lc '
  export PNPM_HOME=\"\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm\"; export PATH=\"\$PNPM_HOME:\$PATH\";
  cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend
  RS_MAJOR=\$(node -e \"try{const p=require(\\\"./package.json\\\");const v=((p.devDependencies&&p.devDependencies[\\\"react-scripts\\\"])||(p.dependencies&&p.dependencies[\\\"react-scripts\\\"])||0);const m=String(v).match(/\\\\d+/);console.log(m?m[0]:0)}catch(e){console.log(0)}\")
  BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS=\"--max-old-space-size=4096\"
  if [ \"\$RS_MAJOR\" -le 4 ] && [ \"\$RS_MAJOR\" -gt 0 ]; then BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS=\"\$BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS --openssl-legacy-provider\"; fi
  NODE_OPTIONS=\"\$BUILD_NODE_OPTIONS\" pnpm run build
'"
run_quiet "Cleanup pnpm tmpfs..." "umount -f /mnt/pnpm-cache 2>/dev/null || true; rmdir /mnt/pnpm-cache 2>/dev/null || true"
save_checkpoint "ETAPA_19_BUILD_COMPLETO"

#------------------- ETAPA 20: PM2 ---------------------------------------------
run_quiet "$(t configuring) PM2 apps..." "bash -lc '
  lsof -ti:${backend_port} | xargs -r kill -9 2>/dev/null || true
  lsof -ti:${frontend_port} | xargs -r kill -9 2>/dev/null || true
  /usr/bin/sudo -u deploy bash -lc \"export PNPM_HOME=\\\$HOME/.local/share/pnpm; export PATH=\\\$PNPM_HOME:\\\$PATH; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/backend; pm2 delete ${empresa}-backend 2>/dev/null || true; pm2 start dist/server.js --name ${empresa}-backend -i 2; cd /home/deploy/${empresa}/frontend; pm2 delete ${empresa}-frontend 2>/dev/null || true; pm2 start server.js --name ${empresa}-frontend; pm2 save\"
'"
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}

{"output":"# Plano Multi-Tarefa: Incorporar Patches do Instalador ao Repositório

## 1. Preparação
- [ ] Mapear a branch base e abrir issue/PR para sincronizar ajustes do instalador.
- [ ] Consolidar `scripts/chatia-install.log` recente comprovando os trechos que ainda executam patches manuais.
- [ ] Levantar versão atual do backend/frontend (commit/tag) para alinhar dependências e artefatos gerados.

## 2. Backend
- [ ] Copiar o `tsconfig.json` gerado pelo instalador (`instalador.sh:1428`) para `backend/tsconfig.json`, garantindo que o repositório já contenha as opções esperadas.
- [ ] Adicionar em `backend/package.json` e `pnpm-lock.yaml` todas as dependências instaladas pelo script (`puppeteer-core`, `glob`, `jimp`, `mime`, `form-data`, `qs`, `bluebird`, `@types/*` etc.).
- [ ] Atualizar imports em todas as referências `mime-types` → `mime` no backend (ação hoje feita via `sed` em `instalador.sh:1429`).
- [ ] Aplicar o fallback `mime.lookup(media) || 'application/octet-stream'` diretamente em `src/services/WbotServices/SendWhatsAppMediaFlow.ts`.
- [ ] Revisar o wrapper de FFmpeg: expor `FFMPEG_PATH` ou configurar `@ffmpeg-installer/ffmpeg` para usar `/usr/bin/ffmpeg`, evitando a edição de `node_modules` realizada em `instalador.sh:1432`.

## 3. Frontend
- [ ] Atualizar `frontend/package.json` para incluir as dependências adicionadas pelo instalador (`axios`, `clsx`, `moment`, polyfills browserify, `express`, `dotenv`, `@craco/craco`, plugins Babel etc.) e garantir consistência no lockfile.
- [ ] Versionar `frontend/craco.config.js` com os mesmos ajustes de webpack gerados em `instalador.sh:1493-1521`.
- [ ] Adicionar `frontend/server.js` (Express + dotenv) ao repositório e ajustar scripts `start/build/test` para usar `craco`.
- [ ] Criar e versionar `frontend/src/config/env.js`, `Env.js`, `env.ts`, `Env.ts` com a lógica de carregamento de variáveis hoje escrita pelo instalador.
- [ ] Remover `react-trello` do repositório e substituir pelas páginas placeholder Kanban/Tags conforme conteúdo gerado em `instalador.sh:1595-1688`.
- [ ] Ajustar `frontend/src/index.js` e `frontend/src/index.tsx` para chamar `serviceWorker.unregister()` de forma permanente.

## 4. Ajustes no Instalador
- [ ] Eliminar blocos de `instalador.sh` que recriam arquivos agora versionados (tsconfig, craco config, envs, server.js, Kanban, service worker).
- [ ] Remover comandos `pnpm add` redundantes, mantendo apenas `pnpm install` com locks do repositório.
- [ ] Substituir alterações em `node_modules` por configuração via env/variáveis documentadas.
- [ ] Garantir que o instalador continue apenas sincronizando o código (`git clone`/`rsync`) e aplicando variáveis de ambiente (.env backend/frontend).

## 5. Validação e Release
- [ ] Executar `bash -n instalador.sh` e `shellcheck instalador.sh` após a limpeza.
- [ ] Realizar deploy completo em ambiente de teste usando o código atualizado, registrando `scripts/chatia-install.log`.
- [ ] Validar build do backend (`pnpm run build`) e frontend (`pnpm run build`) diretamente do repositório sem patches extras.
- [ ] Atualizar documentação/README descrevendo novas variáveis (`FFMPEG_PATH`) e fluxo simplificado.
- [ ] Criar tag/release e comunicar operadores que o instalador agora assume o código já preparado no GitHub.
","metadata":{"exit_code":0,"duration_seconds":0.0}}
